[SYNTAX]: Occasionally complex sentence structures may impede immediate clarity.
[LEXICON]: Some archaic or less common vocabulary (e.g., "saeculum mirabile", "epigoni") might require additional effort for general readers.

[TRANSITION]: Transitions between historical periods and ideas could be smoother in a few instances.
[CLARITY]: Assumed historical knowledge (e.g., specific events, figures) might leave some readers needing external context.

[SYNTAX]: Complex sentence structures may impede smooth reading in some instances.
[LEXICON]: Occasional use of less common vocabulary (e.g., "lurid pictures", "squalid wretchedness") might slow comprehension for some readers.

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from discussing intellectual life to the condition of the working class without a clear connecting phrase.
[STRUCTURE]: Non-linear progression of ideas (e.g., moving from 1812 to 1831, then to general statements, and back to specific historical events).
